name: Emgage Foundation
mission: Emgage is a national, non-partisan organization that informs and mobilizes Muslim American voters in support of policies that enable our communities to ...
theoryOfChange: By educating and mobilizing Muslim voters and training the next generation of leaders, the organization builds political power to ensure Muslim voices are represented in policy-making and democracy.
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" on Emgage Foundation's website or donation pages, nor any dedicated zakat funds or campaigns were found in the search results. The organization's focus appears to be on civic engagement, political representation, and advocacy for Muslim Americans. While a board member is associated with a 'Zakat Fund of NYC', this does not indicate that Emgage Foundation itself accepts zakat donations. (Source: https://emgageusa.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 22/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

score_details.score_summary: Emgage Foundation shows strong impact and moderate alignment.

zakat.claim_evidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" on Emgage Foundation's website or donation pages, nor any dedicated zakat funds or campaigns were found in the search results. The organization's focus appears to be on civic engagement, political representation, and advocacy for Muslim Americans. While a board member is associated with a 'Zakat Fund of NYC', this does not indicate that Emgage Foundation itself accepts zakat donations. (Source: https://emgageusa.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization increases voter turnout in engaged counties and runs programs like the Million Muslim Votes campaign.
The organization offers various donation options and is a recipient of sadaqah-eligible charitable giving.
The organization is categorized under advocacy with specific donor fit and cause urgency metrics.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,918,661, a program expense ratio of 93.3%, working capital of 15.3 months, and fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 due to its high program efficiency and strong financial health, though its specialized focus on advocacy may not align with all donor preferences.
areas_for_improvement: Limited alignment for traditional Muslim donors seeking direct humanitarian aid rather than political advocacy
Dependency on systemic change outcomes which can be difficult to measure in the short term

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 22/50 reflects a medium fit; while the organization addresses the urgent cause of civic advocacy, its 'low' donor fit rating suggests it may not match the priorities of donors looking for traditional charitable services [3]. The organization is verified as sadaqah-eligible for those wishing to contribute to community empowerment [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a high impact score of 38/50 by focusing on systemic change, specifically increasing voter turnout in key states like Pennsylvania, Virginia, and Michigan [1]. Its financial health is robust, characterized by a 93.3% program expense ratio and 15.3 months of working capital [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Emgage Foundation is a national non-partisan organization dedicated to mobilizing Muslim American voters through civic engagement and leadership development.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.3%, indicating the vast majority of funds go directly to civic programs
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 15.3 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Emgage Foundation informs and mobilizes Muslim American voters to support policies that empower their communities through initiatives like the Million Muslim Votes campaign [1][4]. The organization maintains a high level of financial transparency and efficiency, reporting total revenue of $4,918,661 [4]. Individuals can support these advocacy efforts through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods [2].

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 due to its high program efficiency and strong financial health, though its specialized focus on advocacy may not align with all donor preferences.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently operates with a <cite id="16">minimal board of 4 members</cite>, which may limit diverse oversight as the foundation grows.
While impact is verified, the foundation is still <cite id="17">developing a formal theory of change</cite> with explicit causal pathways.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization provides audited financial statements and maintains high transparency through Candid.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The foundation mitigates these risks through high transparency and a <cite id="13">strong reserve of 15.3 months of capital</cite>.
risk_factors: <cite id="17">Developing theory of change</cite> may make long-term impact difficult to quantify
<cite id="16">Small board size</cite> relative to the organization's $4.9M revenue scale

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly reliable and recent.

known_gaps: Theory of change is still developing

alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="23">clearly stating the sadaqah-only status</cite> of donations to manage donor expectations regarding religious tax obligations.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this organization due to its <cite id="14">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and the presence of <cite id="15">93.3% independent board members</cite>. Financial data is consistently reported, with <cite id="4">2023 filings showing $4.9M in revenue</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, the organization could <cite id="16">expand its board size</cite> beyond the current four members to enhance institutional oversight.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="8">93.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a low <cite id="19">cost per beneficiary of approximately $3.71</cite>. The model focuses on <cite id="20">systemic change through voter turnout</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="17">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> that explicitly links civic training to long-term policy outcomes.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes with developing theory of change

rich_narrative.headline: Emgage Foundation is a national non-partisan organization dedicated to mobilizing Muslim American voters through civic engagement and leadership development.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize American Muslim political empowerment and want to invest in the long-term civic infrastructure of the community.
donor_motivations: Want to increase Muslim American representation in policy-making
Value highly efficient organizations with zero-waste fundraising models
Believe in systemic change through voter mobilization
Seek to support non-partisan civic engagement
giving_considerations: Impact is measured in voter turnout and policy influence rather than direct aid
Organization is in a high-growth phase with a 65.6% CAGR
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those looking for immediate humanitarian relief like food or medical aid.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="24">verified outcome tracking of 5 metrics</cite> and historical data showing <cite id="25">voter turnout increases</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Emgage mobilizes voters to influence policy, creating a feedback loop of civic empowerment for Muslim Americans.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that civic training actually translates into higher voter participation.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="5">65.6% growth rate</cite>, the organization is successfully scaling to meet the needs of a national voter mobilization strategy.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="8">unusually high 100.0% program ratio</cite> and <cite id="9">minimal fundraising costs</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses more on policy advocacy in DC

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="8">93.3% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are utilized almost entirely for civic mobilization.
Emgage maintains <cite id="13">15.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a strong financial cushion for long-term advocacy campaigns.
The foundation holds a <cite id="14">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of disclosure available.

strengths_deep_dive: Emgage Foundation's operational model is characterized by high efficiency and strategic growth. Their <cite id="9">fundraising cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised</cite> is significantly lower than industry averages, allowing for maximum resource allocation to their <cite id="6">Million Muslim Votes</cite> initiative. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated an ability to scale rapidly, as evidenced by its <cite id="5">65.6% revenue growth rate</cite> over the last three years. This scale is matched by governance stability, featuring a <cite id="15">board with 93.3% independent members</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">2017</cite>, Emgage Foundation is a national, non-partisan organization dedicated to <cite id="2">mobilizing Muslim American voters</cite> through civic engagement and leadership development. The organization operates as a critical bridge between the Muslim community and the American political process, focusing on <cite id="3">policies that enable communities to thrive</cite>. In 2023, the foundation reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $4,918,661</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 65.6%</cite>. This rapid growth supports a diverse range of initiatives, including the <cite id="6">Million Muslim Votes Campaign</cite> and the <cite id="7">Emerging Leaders Program</cite>. Emgage demonstrates exceptional financial discipline, maintaining a <cite id="8">program expense ratio of 93.3%</cite> and a <cite id="9">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Their work spans several key states, including <cite id="10">Pennsylvania, Florida, Michigan, and Texas</cite>, where they implement <cite id="11">Get Out The Vote (GOTV) programming</cite> and civic trainings. By focusing on systemic change, Emgage aims to forge a path to <cite id="12">sustainable peace and safety</cite> for all people through increased political participation.
